name: scaleway
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing scaleway cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`scaleway` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/scaleway/terraform-provider-scaleway).

action.description: The action to take when rule match. Possible values are: `accept` or `drop`.

ip.description: The ip this rule apply to. If no `ip` nor `ip_range` are specified, rule will apply to all ip. Only one of `ip` and `ip_range` should be specified.

ipRange.description: The ip range (e.g `192.168.1.0/24`) this rule applies to. If no `ip` nor `ip_range` are specified, rule will apply to all ip. Only one of `ip` and `ip_range` should be specified.

port.description: The port this rule applies to. If no `port` nor `port_range` are specified, the rule will apply to all port. Only one of `port` and `port_range` should be specified.

protocol.description: The protocol this rule apply to. Possible values are: `TCP`, `UDP`, `ICMP` or `ANY`.

zone.description: `zone`) The zone in which the server should be created.

deleteOnTermination.description: Forces deletion of the root volume on instance termination.

sizeInGb.description:
Size of the root volume in gigabytes.
To find the right size use [this endpoint](https://api.scaleway.com/instance/v1/zones/fr-par-1/products/servers) and
check the `volumes_constraint.{min|max}_size` (in bytes) for your `commercial_type`.
Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

volumeId.description: The volume ID of the root volume of the server.

key.description: The private key of the device, in case it is generated by Scaleway.

publish.description: Rules used to restrict topics the device can publish to.

subscribe.description: Rules used to restrict topics the device can subscribe to.

enable.description:
Set to `true` to enable Kubernetes patch version auto upgrades.
> **Important:** When enabling auto upgrades, the `version` field take a minor version like x.y (ie 1.18).

maintenanceWindowDay.description: The day of the auto upgrade maintenance window (`monday` to `sunday`, or `any`).

maintenanceWindowStartHour.description: The start hour (UTC) of the 2-hour auto upgrade maintenance window (0 to 23).

balanceSimilarNodeGroups.description: Detect similar node groups and balance the number of nodes between them.

disableScaleDown.description: Disables the scale down feature of the autoscaler.

estimator.description: Type of resource estimator to be used in scale up.

expander.description: Type of node group expander to be used in scale up.

expendablePodsPriorityCutoff.description: Pods with priority below cutoff will be expendable. They can be killed without any consideration during scale down and they don't cause scale up. Pods with null priority (PodPriority disabled) are non expendable.

ignoreDaemonsetsUtilization.description: Ignore DaemonSet pods when calculating resource utilization for scaling down.

maxGracefulTerminationSec.description: Maximum number of seconds the cluster autoscaler waits for pod termination when trying to scale down a node

scaleDownDelayAfterAdd.description: How long after scale up that scale down evaluation resumes.

scaleDownUnneededTime.description: How long a node should be unneeded before it is eligible for scale down.

scaleDownUtilizationThreshold.description: Node utilization level, defined as sum of requested resources divided by capacity, below which a node can be considered for scale down

clusterCaCertificate.description: The CA certificate of the Kubernetes API server.

token.description: The token to connect to the Kubernetes API server.

clientId.description: A client id that all tokens must be issued for

groupsClaims.description: JWT claim to use as the user's group

issuerUrl.description: URL of the provider which allows the API server to discover public signing keys

requiredClaims.description: Multiple key=value pairs that describes a required claim in the ID Token

usernameClaim.description: JWT claim to use as the user name

name.description:
The name for the pool.
> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

maxSurge.description: The maximum number of nodes to be created during the upgrade

maxUnavailable.description: The maximum number of nodes that can be not ready at the same time

action.description: Action to undertake when an ACL filter matches.

match.description: The ACL match rule. At least `ip_subnet` or `http_filter` and `http_filter_value` are required.

name.description: The ACL name. If not provided it will be randomly generated.

type.description: The action type. Possible values are: `allow` or `deny`.

httpFilter.description:
The HTTP filter to match. This filter is supported only if your backend protocol has an HTTP forward protocol.
It extracts the request's URL path, which starts at the first slash and ends before the question mark (without the host part).
Possible values are: `acl_http_filter_none`, `path_begin`, `path_end` or `regex`.

httpFilterValues.description: A list of possible values to match for the given HTTP filter.

invert.description: If set to `true`, the condition will be of type "unless".

ipSubnets.description: A list of IPs or CIDR v4/v6 addresses of the client of the session to match.

zone.description: `zone`) The zone in which the IP should be reserved.

allowedMethods.description: Specifies which methods are allowed. Can be `GET`, `PUT`, `POST`, `DELETE` or `HEAD`.

exposeHeaders.description: Specifies expose header in the response.

maxAgeSeconds.description: Specifies time in seconds that browser can cache the response for a preflight request.

enabled.description: Enable versioning. Once you version-enable a bucket, it can never return to an unversioned state. You can, however, suspend versioning on that bucket.

frequency.description: Frequency of the memory in MHz.

provider.description:
The provider type for the scaleway package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

dnsZone.description: The DNS Zone of the domain. If the DNS zone doesn't exist, it will be automatically created.

geoIp.description: The Geo IP feature provides DNS resolution, based on the users geographical location. You can define a default IP that resolves if no Geo IP rule matches, and specify IPs for each geographical zone. [Documentation and usage example](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/scaleway-dns/#-Geo-IP-Records)

httpService.description: The DNS service checks the provided URL on the configured IPs and resolves the request to one of the IPs by excluding the ones not responding to the given string to check. [Documentation and usage example](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/scaleway-dns/#-Healthcheck-records)

keepEmptyZone.description: When destroying a resource, if only NS records remain and this is set to `false`, the zone will be deleted. Please note, each zone not deleted will [cost you money](https://www.scaleway.com/en/dns/)

name.description: The name of the record (can be an empty string for a root record).

priority.description: The priority of the record (mostly used with an `MX` record)

ttl.description: Time To Tive of the record in seconds.

type.description: The type of the record (`A`, `AAAA`, `MX`, `CNAME`, `ALIAS`, `NS`, `PTR`, `SRV`, `TXT`, `TLSA`, or `CAA`).

views.description: The answer to a DNS request is based on the clients (resolver) subnet. *(Can be more than 1)* [Documentation and usage example](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/scaleway-dns/#-Views-records)

weighteds.description: You provide a list of IPs with their corresponding weights. These weights are used to proportionally direct requests to each IP. Depending on the weight of a record more or fewer requests are answered with its related IP compared to the others in the list. *(Can be more than 1)* [Documentation and usage example](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/scaleway-dns/#-Weight-Records)

views.description: The answer to a DNS request is based on the clients (resolver) subnet. *(Can be more than 1)* [Documentation and usage example](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/scaleway-dns/#-Views-records)

weighteds.description: You provide a list of IPs with their corresponding weights. These weights are used to proportionally direct requests to each IP. Depending on the weight of a record more or fewer requests are answered with its related IP compared to the others in the list. *(Can be more than 1)* [Documentation and usage example](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/scaleway-dns/#-Weight-Records)

scaleway:index/instanceSecurityGroup:Ins.description:
## Import

Instance security group can be imported using the `{zone}/{id}`, e.g. bash

```sh
 $ pulumi import scaleway:index/instanceSecurityGroup:InstanceSecurityGroup web fr-par-1/11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

description.description: The description of the security group.

enableDefaultSecurity.description: Whether to block SMTP on IPv4/IPv6 (Port 25, 465, 587). Set to false will unblock SMTP if your account is authorized to. If your organization is not yet authorized to send SMTP traffic, [open a support ticket](https://console.scaleway.com/support/tickets).

externalRules.description:
A boolean to specify whether to use instance_security_group_rules.
If `external_rules` is set to `true`, `inbound_rule` and `outbound_rule` can not be set directly in the security group.

inboundDefaultPolicy.description: The default policy on incoming traffic. Possible values are: `accept` or `drop`.

inboundRules.description: A list of inbound rule to add to the security group. (Structure is documented below.)

name.description: The name of the security group.

organizationId.description: The organization ID the security group is associated with.

outboundDefaultPolicy.description: The default policy on outgoing traffic. Possible values are: `accept` or `drop`.

outboundRules.description: A list of outbound rule to add to the security group. (Structure is documented below.)

## Import

IoT devices can be imported using the `{region}/{id}`, e.g. bash

```sh
 $ pulumi import scaleway:index/iotDevice:IotDevice device01 fr-par/11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

allowInsecure.description: Allow plain and server-authenticated TLS connections in addition to mutually-authenticated ones.

allowMultipleConnections.description: Allow more than one simultaneous connection using the same device credentials.

certificate.description: The certificate bundle of the device.

createdAt.description: The date and time the device was created.

description.description: The description of the IoT device (e.g. `living room`).

hubId.description: The ID of the hub on which this device will be created.

isConnected.description: The current connection status of the device.

lastActivityAt.description: The last MQTT activity of the device.

messageFilters.description: Rules that define which messages are authorized or denied based on their topic.

region.description: The region you want to attach the resource to

status.description: The current status of the device.

scaleway:index/iotNetwork:IotNetwork.description:
## Import

IoT Networks can be imported using the `{region}/{id}`, e.g. bash

```sh
 $ pulumi import scaleway:index/iotNetwork:IotNetwork net01 fr-par/11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

createdAt.description: The date and time the Network was created.

endpoint.description: The endpoint to use when interacting with the network.

hubId.description: The hub ID to which the Network will be attached to.

name.description: The name of the IoT Network you want to create (e.g. `my-net`).

secret.description: The endpoint key to keep secret.

topicPrefix.description: The prefix that will be prepended to all topics for this Network.

hubId.description: The hub ID to which the Network will be attached to.

name.description: The name of the IoT Network you want to create (e.g. `my-net`).

topicPrefix.description: The prefix that will be prepended to all topics for this Network.

scaleway:index/kubernetesCluster:Kuberne.description:
## Import

Kubernetes clusters can be imported using the `{region}/{id}`, e.g. bash

```sh
 $ pulumi import scaleway:index/kubernetesCluster:KubernetesCluster mycluster fr-par/11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

admissionPlugins.description: The list of [admission plugins](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/admission-controllers/) to enable on the cluster.

apiserverCertSans.description: Additional Subject Alternative Names for the Kubernetes API server certificate

apiserverUrl.description: The URL of the Kubernetes API server.

autoscalerConfig.description: The configuration options for the [Kubernetes cluster autoscaler](https://github.com/kubernetes/autoscaler/tree/master/cluster-autoscaler).

cni.description:
The Container Network Interface (CNI) for the Kubernetes cluster.
> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

createdAt.description: The creation date of the cluster.

deleteAdditionalResources.description: Delete additional resources like block volumes and loadbalancers that were created in Kubernetes on cluster deletion.

description.description: A description for the Kubernetes cluster.

featureGates.description: The list of [feature gates](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/command-line-tools-reference/feature-gates/) to enable on the cluster.

kubeconfigs.description: The kubeconfig configuration file of the Kubernetes cluster

name.description: The name for the Kubernetes cluster.

openIdConnectConfig.description: The OpenID Connect configuration of the cluster

organizationId.description: The organization ID the cluster is associated with.

projectId.description: `project_id`) The ID of the project the cluster is associated with.

region.description: `region`) The region in which the cluster should be created.

status.description: The status of the Kubernetes cluster.

tags.description: The tags associated with the Kubernetes cluster.

updatedAt.description: The last update date of the cluster.

upgradeAvailable.description: Set to `true` if a newer Kubernetes version is available.

version.description: The version of the Kubernetes cluster.

Network name if created along a GatewayNetwork, or else to `priv`.

dnsServerOverrides.description: Override the DNS server list pushed to DHCP clients, instead of the gateway itself

enableDynamic.description:
Whether to enable dynamic pooling of IPs. By turning the dynamic pool off, only pre-existing DHCP reservations will be
handed out. Defaults to true.

organizationId.description: The organization ID the public gateway DHCP config is associated with.

poolHigh.description: High IP (included) of the dynamic address pool. Defaults to the last address of the subnet.

poolLow.description: Low IP (included) of the dynamic address pool. Defaults to the second address of the subnet.

pushDefaultRoute.description: Whether the gateway should push a default route to DHCP clients or only hand out IPs. Defaults to true

pushDnsServer.description:
Whether the gateway should push custom DNS servers to clients. This allows for instance hostname -> IP resolution.
Defaults to true.

rebindTimer.description:
After how long, in seconds, a DHCP client will query for a new lease if previous renews fail. Must be 30s lower than
`valid_lifetime`. Defaults to 51m (3060s).

renewTimer.description: After how long, in seconds, a renew will be attempted. Must be 30s lower than `rebind_timer`. Defaults to 50m (3000s).
